dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.
dependencies.name: gmake

dependencies.description:
Perl 5 is a highly capable, feature-rich programming language with over
27 years of development.
dependencies.name: perl

dependent_to.description:
IPC::Run allows you to run and interact with child processes using
files, pipes, and pseudo-ttys. Both system()-style and scripted usages
are supported and may be mixed. Likewise, functional and OO API styles
are both supported and may be mixed.
dependent_to.name: perl-ipc-run

description:
IO::Tty is used internally by IO::Pty to create a pseudo-tty. You
wouldn't want to use it directly except to import constants, use
IO::Pty. For a list of importable constants, see IO::Tty::Constant.
name: perl-io-tty

variants.description: Build systems supported by the package
variants.name: build_system
